data.name: Aerodactyl
data.flavorText: A ferocious prehistoric Pokémon that goes for the enemy's throat with its serrated saw-like fangs.

data.name: Articuno
data.flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

data.name: Ditto
data.flavorText: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.

data.name: Dragonite
data.flavorText: An extremely rarely seen marine Pokémon. Its intelligence is said to match that of humans.

data.name: Gengar
data.flavorText: Under a full moon, this Pokémon likes to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.

data.name: Haunter
data.flavorText: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.

data.name: Hitmonlee
data.flavorText: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra long, loping strides.

data.name: Hypno
data.flavorText: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of psi moves such as Hypnosis and Confusion.

data.name: Kabutops
data.flavorText: Its sleek shape is perfect for swimming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains the body fluids.

data.name: Lapras
data.flavorText: A Pokémon that has been overhunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people across water.

data.name: Magneton
data.flavorText: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

data.name: Moltres
data.flavorText: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.

data.name: Muk
data.flavorText: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

data.name: Raichu
data.flavorText: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.

data.name: Zapdos
data.flavorText: A legendary thunderbird Pokémon whose anger is said to cause storms. Some say it has lived above the clouds for thousands of years.

data.flavorText: A ferocious prehistoric Pokémon that goes for the enemy's throat with its serrated saw-like fangs.

data.name: Magneton
data.flavorText: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

data.name: Moltres
data.flavorText: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.

data.name: Muk
data.flavorText: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

data.name: Raichu
data.flavorText: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high voltage power.

data.name: Zapdos
data.flavorText: A legendary thunderbird Pokémon whose anger is said to cause storms. Some say it has lived above the clouds for thousands of years.

data.name: Arbok
data.flavorText: It is rumored that the ferocious warning markings on its belly differ from area to area.

data.name: Cloyster
data.flavorText: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.

data.name: Gastly
data.flavorText: A mysterious Pokémon. Some say it is a lifeform from another dimension, while other believe it is formed from smog.

data.name: Golbat
data.flavorText: Once it strikes, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.

data.name: Golduck
data.flavorText: Often seen swimming elegantly by lake shores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster, Kappa.

data.name: Golem
data.flavorText: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without damage.

data.name: Graveler
data.flavorText: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.

data.name: Kingler
data.flavorText: The large pincer has 10,000 horsepower of crushing power. However, its huge size makes it unwieldy to use.

data.name: Magmar
data.flavorText: Found at the mouths of volcanoes and extremely hard to spot. There are very few instances of capturing this Pokémon.

data.name: Omastar
data.flavorText: A prehistoric Pokémon that died out when its heavy shell made it impossible for it to catch prey.

data.name: Sandslash
data.flavorText: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.

data.name: Seadra
data.flavorText: Capable of swimming backward by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.

data.name: Slowbro
data.flavorText: The Shellder that is latched onto Slowpoke's tail is said to feed on the host's left-over scraps.

data.name: Tentacruel
data.flavorText: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.

data.name: Weezing
data.flavorText: Where two kinds of poison gases meet, two Koffings can fuse into a Weezing over many years.

data.name: Ekans
data.flavorText: Moves silently and stealthily. Eats the eggs of birds such as Pidgey and Spearow whole.

data.name: Geodude
data.flavorText: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

data.name: Grimer
data.flavorText: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.

data.name: Horsea
data.flavorText: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.

data.name: Kabuto
data.flavorText: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor eons ago.

data.name: Krabby
data.flavorText: Its pincers are not only powerful weapons, they are used for balance when walking sideways.

data.name: Omanyte
data.flavorText: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically resurrected from fossils.

data.name: Psyduck
data.flavorText: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily Pokémon will use psychokinetic powers.

data.name: Shellder
data.flavorText: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

data.name: Slowpoke
data.flavorText: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes 5 seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.

data.name: Tentacool
data.flavorText: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid.

data.name: Zubat
data.flavorText: Forms colonies in perpetually dark places. Uses ultrasonic waves to identify and approach targets.
